blog.name: winniethehowell
blog.title: Dan Is Literally A Teddy Bear
blog.description: Dee. 18. She/Her. Is hardcore believer Dan is a Pooh bear and Phil is Tigger

body:
Just Friends

Summary: Based on the show Friends!

Chapter 10- The Chapter With The Vidcon Video

Two months had gone by, and Dan still hadn’t forgiven Phil. He had forgiven him as a friend, but not as a boyfriend. Phil was beginning to wonder if Dan ever would

He was talking to Martyn and Sophie about it while they had coffee in the cafe. He sighed, “I know what happened was, well, bad, but I didn’t think he’d stay mad.”

Martyn shrugged. “There’s not much you can do about it. Dan saw a list you made of everything you didn’t like about him, I don’t think you can do much to recover from that.”

“But I need to figure out how to say I’m sorry in the right way. I need him.” Phil looked at Martyn. “I know I’ve only known him for four months, but I am in love with him.”

Martyn offered a small smile. “Maybe just give it a little longer.”

At that moment Dan was going in to join them, he smiled at Martyn and said hi, than gave Phil a small smile. Phil felt like his heart would burst if he had to see those deep dimples in those rosy cheeks one more time and he wasn’t able to kiss them. Dan walked up to the counter to get a coffee and Phil turned to Martyn. “I swear, someone has it in for me to keep him from me.”

Sophie chimed in, finally wrapping up eating her muffin. “It will work out. It has to.”

“How do you know?” Phil asked her

“Because you’re lobsters, it has to.”

Phil and Martyn looked at her confused, their eyebrows furrowing. “What do you mean they’re lobesters?” Martyn asked, dumbfounded

“Lobsters find another lobster and mate for life.” Sophie explained. “It’s just a more creative way of saying you’re soulmates.”

Phil nodded, he always admired how Sophie’s mind worked. He turned around to look at Dan again and saw a guy talking to him. A guy who was tall, has big arms, clearly very fit, and very handsome. He saw them laughing and Dan had a blush on his cheeks

“Oh my gosh.” Phil said, turning to Martyn and Sophie. “That guy is attacking him.”

“What?” It was Sophie’s turn to be confused with Martyn. “It seems like they’re flirting.”

Phil turned around and saw Dan laugh and put his hand on the guys chest. Phil turned back around and said, “No, see how Dan is pushing him away and he won’t back off, I gotta go help him!”

As Phil stood Martyn grabbed his hand and said, “Do you think that’s a good idea?”

“Yes!” Phil pulled away and quickly thought of a plan. As he got there, he tapped on Dan’s shoulder. “Hey Dan, my name is Phil, I’m the one who messaged you on Tinder.”

“What are you doing?” Dan’s smile fell from his face

Phil ignored Dan and looked at the guy. “Oh I know you said you talked to a few guys all at once but this guy is impressive!”

The guy scratched his back and he looked at Dan, who was trying to explain, “I don’t know what he’s talking about-“

“That’s okay.” The guy cut Dan off. “I’m going to go. You can call me if you want.”

As the guy left, Dan said, “But I don’t have your number.”

The guy ignored him and left the cafe. Phil smiled at Dan, who was frowning at him, and cluelessly said, “Your welcome.”

“What?”

“I saved you.”

“Saved me from what? The attractive, funny guy?” Dan was very upset

“Well from where I was, it looked like-“

“I don’t care what it looked like to you!” Dan said quietly. “I’m not yours to save.”

“But were lobsters.” Phil responded, explaining, “Sophie said that we’re lobsters because they find someone and they mate for life.”

Dan frowned. “I don’t care what Sophie thinks, we are not going to happen, accept that.”

“Except that what?” Phil asked, not understanding

“No.” Dan looked Phil in the eyes. “Accept that.”

Phil felt his heart fall. “Oh.” He awkwardly stepped away and said, “Sorry I ruined your conversation.” And quietly went back home.

-

Later that night everyone was over Martyn’s apartment. While things with Dan and Phil were a little awkward, everyone was having fun. At one pint during the night Cornelia found a tape on top of Martyns tv. “What’s this?” She asked Martyn, who shrugged and told her to pop it in. Everyone gathered around the tv except for Phil, who was in the fridge getting a drink

As the video started they all knew what it was. “This is us getting ready for Vidcon!”

Phil turned around with his eyes wide. “We don’t have to watch this.”

Everyone ignored him saying it would be fun. Phil sighed and stood behind the couch. It went through all of them getting ready and Dan crying when Eric was late. Suddenly, the video turned as Martyn talked to Phil saying, “You should take Dan to Vidcon.”

The video continues with Phil shaking his head. “I don’t know.” As the camera panned back to Dan who clearly very upset as he cried at that point. Martyn turned back to Phil. “He’s crying, he’s heartbroken, you don’t have to do anything, just go with him.”

Dan watched the video with a confused look. He had no idea that this happened. He was wondering why Phil never told him

Phil in the video nodded. “Okay. Let’s go to your room and get some something to wear.”

As Martyn and Phil went to another hotel room to get Phil something to wear, Phil said, “We don’t have to watch the rest-“

Once again everyone told him it would be fun, but really they were all curious as to what would happen. “Fine, But I’m not going to watch.” Phil turned and headed for the door. Dan watched the rest of the video with his eyebrows furrowed as he was confused

Martyn filmed Phil come out in a nice, blue button up and clean fitted jeans, looking stunning. “Okay let’s go get your damsel in distress.” Martyn jokes but as he peaked the door open a tiny bit, he saw Dan with his date. He turned to see that Phil saw too, and his face looked heart broken

Phil watched the video by the door as he turned away. Dan watched, shocked and tears filling up in his eyes. Dan eyes turned to the floor and he stared at it, thoughts going through his head

As the video was cut off, Cornelia turned around to look at Phil. “I can’t believe you did that.”

Everyone but Dan turned and looked at Phil. Phil shrugged, quietly saying, “Yeah, well…..”

Dan looked up from the floor to Phil, his eyes glossy with tears. He walked over to Phil, a pout on his lips. When he got to Phil, he put his hands on Phil’s cheeks and connected his lips to Phil’s

Phil was kissing Dan back very quickly. Everyone else watched smiling at them. As they pulled away, Dan smiled at Phil and hugged him. Phil wrapped his arms around Dan too, both of them feeling their hearts fill up for the other

“See?” Sophie said to the others, happily. “They’re lobsters!”

summary: they say there's magic in the stars, that the world above holds so many trips and tricks that down here we couldn't even dream...
caption:
they say there’s magic in the stars, that the world above holds so many trips and tricks that down here we couldn’t even dream of. they’re right. but nothing up there, not even the brightest of stars or the glow of the galaxies, could ever live up to what you and i right here.
.
.
.
.
.
.
aye i wanted to make myself a halloween icon and I really like how it turned out so welp. also kinda based off Inktober Day 8 cause stars ok bye
.

summary: Just a simple reminder that spooky week starts in about 17 days, pinof comes out in one month, and gamingmas starts in 54 days
body: Just a simple reminder that spooky week starts in about 17 days, pinof comes out in one month, and gamingmas starts in 54 days

blog.name: uselessphillie

title: [fic] between two lungs
body:
read on ao3

rating: G // words: 860

summary: Dan leaves for Reading in the early morning. (Canon mark 7 Oct 2018.)

a/n: lmao @ me working on another drabble instead of any of my WIPs. longer stuff coming soon xx

“Phil. Babe, wake up.”

Dan sits cross-legged amongst the pillows on their bed, fully dressed save for his shoes. He’s delayed waking Phil for as long as he possibly could, packing some stray toiletries and sipping on his morning tea, but his train will surely leave without him if he waits any longer.

He strokes his fingers gently through Phil’s hair, pulling out one of the longer strands and using it to tickle across his forehead. Phil makes a non-committal noise from under the duvet, squirming around until he can press his face into Dan’s jean-clad thigh. Seemingly displeased with the rough material he finds there, he blinks open his eyes, squinting up at Dan.

“Hey,” he says, voice thick with sleep.

“Hey.” Dan smooths all the loose bits of quiff back into place and drags his thumb down across Phil’s cheek. “I have to go.”

It had been at Phil’s gentle insistence that he’d bought a ticket to Reading Station. The weeks post-tour had left them both a bit on edge, a bit tetchy with themselves and with each other. His mum had been thrilled when he’d called, in her quiet, reserved way. Colin misses you, she’d said.

(Dan listens to her more closely these days, more than he ever did, and thinks he might have heard we miss you, darling nestled in between her words.)

He’d booked the early train, told his nan that he’d meet her first for breakfast at her favorite spot. But it’s early, the sky barely lightened as Phil finally pushes himself upright against the pillows. Dan runs his palms over sleep-warmed skin as Phil clambers easily into his lap, not even bothering with his glasses. He fits himself koala-like around Dan’s body, all long, bony limbs and fresh stubble against Dan’s cheek and a sigh exhaled into the dip of his shoulder.  

Dan wraps his arms tightly around Phil’s waist, feels the muted thump-thump of his heart where Phil’s bare chest presses against his t-shirt. The noise of the city waking up drifts in through the open window. Their city. Their home, with all its little comforts and turbulences.

Phil turns his head, presses his lips against Dan’s jaw in a not-quite kiss. “I’ll miss you,” he says.

Dan, who is maybe still a little bit fond even through all his tetchiness, says, “You won’t, you’ll have a lie-in and eat a takeaway in your pants and pile up all the blankets in the middle of the bed without my dumb brain to ruin any of it for you.” He keeps his tone light and joking but can practically feel Phil’s expression sour against his shoulder.

Phil pulls back to look at him, but Dan just leans forward in order to avoid the full weight of his gaze. His heads lands against the jut of Phil’s collarbone and that’s where he continues to hide, until he feels Phil reach up and begin to twine his styled curls gently around his fingers.

Phil presses a kiss to the crown of his head, a real one this time. “It’s okay if you bring your dumb brain back with you from Reading,” he says softly. “I’ll pile the blankets in the middle of the lounge instead and make us a homemade takeaway.”

Dan has to fight against the sudden tightness in his chest. “That’s just called cooking us dinner, you know.”

Phil works his fingers under Dan’s jaw until he’s forced to look up. “I know.”

Dan follows the line of Phil’s body down until he finds his hand, fitting his fingers into the empty spaces. Maybe he’s a lot fond. “Love you.”

The rising sun’s got nothing on Phil’s smile, not when he’s pressing into Dan and kissing him soundly. “Love you more.”

“Love you most,” Dan says into the kiss, rolling his eyes even as he indulges Phil with the sappy back-and-forth. It’s all true, anyway.

Phil settles back down against his shoulder. He’s really going to miss his train at this rate. “Love you most-est,” he says, pinching Dan’s side and trying to suppress his grin.

Dan dumps his giggling boyfriend out of his lap, accompanied by a drawn-out Phil-il for good measure. He runs his fingers lightly up Phil’s bare thighs, hovering his body over Phil’s until he holds his hands out in defense, struggling to catch his breath. “Fine, fine, I surrender. You can love me more today. Just today.”

They’ll find their rhythm again, a pattern with strong days and off days, days where they lean into each other and ones where they have to hold each other up fully. For now, he can eat his mum’s bolognese and make her a salad to go with it, he can send Phil a hundred pictures of Colin, he can take his journal and a good pen onto the train and write and write and write until things start to make sense again.

Phil tugs on the hem of his t-shirt, looking up at him, still smiling. “Text me when you get there?”

(He’ll text him before the train even pulls out of the station. But only because he loves Phil most.)

You can love me more today. Just today.”

blog.name: mukbangphillie
blog.title: stressed and depressed
blog.description: ailée | she/her | 16 | canada | header by @cozydnp | @zozeewrites on ao3

tags: but i really just want something to raise my spirits

summary: i just saw this comment on a youtube vid in which dan talks openly about his sexuality. and honestly ive never read anything...
body:
i just saw this comment on a youtube vid in which dan talks openly about his sexuality. and honestly ive never read anything more accurate, like yes i know how when other people are open about these things it makes most people inspired to be open as well and thats good! but its just that dan andphil? for example just like to keep these things private and i think we all need to remind ourselves how that is perfectly fine and its not even our business to begin with.

“i just want dan and phil to be friends forever because they make me so happy” i just love that. they make us happy, and im just really grateful for it.

blog.name: phanfeed-ao3
blog.title: Phanfiction!
blog.description:
!!! READ THE FAQ BEFORE SENDING ME AN ASK !!!

Mobile Links

This blog is autoposts anything that gets put in the Dan Howell/Phil Lester tag on Archive of Our Own (AO3).

Sometimes the applet on IFTT I use straight up breaks. I don't recommend turning on notifications for this blog. Links don't work on mobile.

Admin: Ozzy (foolishdeadbeat)
